Pictured Above: Rep. Neguse meeting with officials from Clear Creek County and the Town of Silverplume earlier this year. My colleagues and I worked tirelessly to secure the enactment of bills like the Inflation Reduction Act, the CHIPS and Science Act, the Bipartisan Safer Communities Act, the American Rescue Plan, the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, and more.

And I am proud to announce that the bill, which now heads to President Biden's desk for signature, included three stand-alone bills previously introduced by my office as well as a key component of our wildland firefighter pay bill, Tim's Act, and funding for local water infrastructure projects. Learn more about what was included below: The Hiring Expansion and Licensure Portability for Military Spouses, or HELP for Military Spouses Act, amends a military spouse hiring roundtable to include a discussion of the benefits of licensure reform and portability through compacts for military spouses; The VA Mental Health Internships, or Mentor Act, expands the definition of a licensed civilian behavioral health care provider; The Surveying the Heat Island Effect across Large Divisions (SHIELD) Act directs the Secretary of Defense to do an inventory of every large-scale military installation for heat islands and then compose a plan to increase greenery coverage for those installments by up to 30%; A provision of Tim's Act that would provide assistance to federal wildland firefighters living with chronic diseases as a result of on-the-job environmental exposure; And an additional authorization of $10 million for Boulder County's wastewater and stormwater management.

Our federal wildland firefighting workforce deserves a living wage, comprehensive health care, and more. That’s why I’ve re-introduced Tim’s Act — legislation that recognizes the heroic work our wildland firefighters do each and everyday. Learn more?? [[url]]
